decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

Notwithstanding the details shown on drawing 03 (Revision G) accompanying the application, the face and cheeks of the rear dormer windows hereby approved shall be tile hung to match the appearance of the roof of the dwelling house unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area.

The roof area of the extensions hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.
In the interests of the amenity of the occupiers of neighbouring dwelling.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via email and telephone. The revisions involved changing the rear dormer proposed from large one to two small ones. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 19/01/22.
description: Single storey rear extension to include facade alterations involving first floor Juliette balconies. Conversion of loft to habitable use to include a two rear dormers and conversion of roof from hip to gable end to include a new front facade gable end window
